translated: The Chapter on Pairs in the Form of Questions

original: 8.30. Ganthaganthasampayuttaduka🔽Naganthañceva naganthavippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nagantho ceva naganthavippayutto🔽ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthañceva naganthavippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽naganthavippayutto ceva nano ca gantho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthañceva
analyzed: gantha gantha sampayutta duka  na gantham ca iva na gantha vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na ganthaḥ ca iva na gantha vippayuttaḥ  ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na gantham ca iva na gantha vippayuttam ca dhammam paṭicca  na gantha vippayuttaḥ ca iva na no ca ganthaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na ganthañca ca iva
translated: The Pairs Connected with the Fetters

original: naganthavippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nagantho ceva naganthavippayutto ca naganthavippayutto🔽ceva nano ca gantho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naganthavippayuttañceva nano ca ganthaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naganthavippayutto ceva nano
analyzed: na gantha vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na ganthaḥ ca iva na gantha vippayuttaḥ ca na gantha vippayuttaḥ  ca iva nano ca gantho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na gantha vippayuttam ca iva na no ca gantham dhammam paṭicca na gantha vippayuttaḥ ca iva na no
translated: With a fetter and with a non-fetter as condition, a fetter arises, a state of result. With a fetter and with a non-fetter as condition, a non-fetter arises, a state of result. With a fetter and with a non-fetter as condition, a fetter arises, a state of result, and a non-fetter arises, a state of result.

original: ca gantho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthavippayuttañceva nano ca ganthaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: ca ganthaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na gantha vippayuttam ca iva na no ca gantham dhamma
translated: With a non-fetter and with a fetter as condition, a non-fetter arises, a state of result. With a non-fetter and with a fetter as condition, a fetter arises, a state of result. With a non-fetter and with a fetter as condition, a non-fetter arises, a state of result, and a fetter arises, a state of result.

original: paṭicca nagantho ceva naganthavippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthavippayuttañceva🔽nano ca ganthaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nagantho ceva naganthavippayutto ca naganthavippayutto🔽ceva nano ca gantho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naganthañceva naganthavippayuttañca naganthavippayuttañceva nano ca ganthañca dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nagantho ceva naganthavippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthañceva🔽naganthavippayuttañca naganthavippayuttañceva nano ca ganthañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naganthavippayutto🔽ceva nano ca gantho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthañceva naganthavippayuttañca
analyzed: paṭicca na ganthaḥ ca iva na gantha vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na gantha vippayuttam ca iva  na no ca gantham dhammam paṭicca na ganthaḥ ca iva na gantha vippayutto ca na gantha vippayutto  ca iva nano ca gantho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na ganthañca ceva na gantha vippayuttañca na gantha vippayuttañca ceva na no ca ganthañca dhamma  paṭicca na ganthaḥ ca iva na gantha vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na gantham ca iva  na gantha vippayuttañca na gantha vippayuttañca ca iva na no ca gantham ca dhammam paṭicca na gantha vippayuttaḥ  ca iva na no ca ganthaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na ganthañca iva na gantha vippayuttañca
translated: A factor that is connected and also unconnected to the fetters arises with the fetters as its condition. A factor that is unconnected to the fetters and also a factor that is connected to the fetters arise with a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as its condition. A factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters arise with a factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as their condition. A factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters arises with a factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as its condition. A factor that is unconnected to the fetters arises with a factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as its condition. A factor that is unconnected to the fetters arises with a factor that is unconnected to the fetters and also a factor that is connected to the fetters as its condition.

original: naganthavippayuttañceva nano ca ganthañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nagantho ceva naganthavippayutto
analyzed: na gantha vippayuttam ca iva na no ca gantham ca dhammam paṭicca na ganthaḥ ca iva na gantha vippayuttaḥ
translated: A factor that is connected and also unconnected to the fetters arises with the fetters as its condition. A factor that is unconnected to the fetters and also a factor that is connected to the fetters arise with a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as its condition. A factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters arise with a factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as their condition. A factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters arise with a factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as their condition. A factor that is unconnected to the fetters arises with a factor that is connected to the fetters and also a factor that is unconnected to the fetters as its condition. A factor that is connected to the fetters arises with a factor that is unconnected to the fetters and also a factor that is connected to the fetters as its condition. A factor that is unconnected to the fetters arises with a factor that is unconnected to the fetters and also a factor that is connected to the fetters as its condition.

original: ca naganthavippayutto ceva nano ca gantho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ca na gantha vippayuttaḥ ca iva na no ca gantho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: and the thoughts that are unfettered and also fetters arise with resultant-consciousness as condition. (In brief.)

analyzed: hetuyā nava pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
translated: With root-cause as condition, nine … with ignorance as condition, nine. (In all cases in detail.)
